title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire Friday 3 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: statue tribute to wartime munitions workers .
former consultant says he 'd rather see hospital shut than face cuts .
teenager recovering after spine op in the usa .
taxi service apologises after blind man refused lift .

documents.title: care provider goes into liquidation
text: care provider goes into liquidation

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day .
we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: your blossom and overcast weather
text: it 's been a fairly miserable day all round , but here are two that caught our eye .
this lovely of pink blossom offset the otherwise grey background - it comes from bbc weather watcher marlaine .
toppo sent in this from doddenham of quite a grey day .
if you have a you 'd like to share , sign up and become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fatal crash closes road
text: one person has died and two people have been seriously injured after a collision on the a451 in worcestershire , police say
west mercia police say the road is closed between great witley and dunley and is likely to stay that way for the next three or four hours .
emergency services were called just after 16:30 this afternoon .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : weather for the evening and the weekend
text: outbreaks of rain will continue for many this evening and for a time overnight , but there will be some drier interludes too .
rain will clear during the early hours .
cloudy skies will keep temperatures up overnight , preventing an overnight frost..
lows of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today : uber drivers refused to take man with guide dog
text: a blind man from birmingham , who works in worcester , says he 's repeatedly been refused taxis operated by the online firm uber because he travels with a guide dog .
saleh ahmed claims it 's happened 14 times in the past two years .
taxis are obliged to carry passengers with service dogs unless there 's a medical reason not to .
uber say it has barred two drivers while they investigate .
there 's more on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: book borrowing bonanza at leintwardine library
text: a library in leintwardine , herefordshire , has bucked the decline of library use in the country .
leintwardine community library has seen an increase of 13 % in the number of books being borrowed .
it is also open for more hours thanks to local volunteers .
a new support group , friends of leintwardine community library , has set itself targets of `` turning round library use , and transforming the way it worked to meet local needs . ''
they also held activities such as children 's writing competitions , craft-making sessions for children and a mini-shakespeare festival .

documents.title: residents voice concern on controversial bromsgrove boundary changes
text: angry residents .
have hit out at plans to controversially re-shape bromsgrove 's boundaries , which would axe eight wards and see and droitwich spa `` lumped in '' .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: slurry pollution : 'high organic content ' in the water
text: we told you earlier .
about slurry pollution in the river frome in herefordshire .
the pollution is affecting the tedstone brook .
the environment agency say they are `` investigating the cause of the pollution '' .
dave throup is the environment agency manager for herefordshire and worcestershire and shared this from the scene .
foam caused by high organic content in water .
# herefordshire slurry pollution
hi dave , do you mind if we save this photo ?
always useful to show people concerned about foam !
thanks
of course , although in this case it is n't natural as caused by slurry pollution
yes i meant to show how different non-natural looks !
thanks
hi dave , where abouts in herefordshire is this ?
ca n't say exactly .
north of bromyard .
thanks dave , completely understand .
out of our catchment area !
keep up the good work , and the publicity
@ twitterid try this one
that does n't look right .

documents.title: flood gate closure to help river levels
text: a flood gate in upton-upon-severn will be closed later today to help manage river levels .
we will be closing the flood gate at new street # upton upon # severn # worcestershire by 5pm today as the river responds to recent rainfall

documents.title: worcester named uk 's happiest city
text: worcester has been named as the uk 's happiest city in a survey .
around 2,000 people were questioned by provident financial , who compiled the findings .
worcester did well in other areas : fifth most welcoming ; third best for its upkeep and ninth for its level of safety .
it would seem the city council are pretty pleased with the result too
congratulations # worcester - you 're living the uk 's # happiest city according to unbroken britain survey
@ twitterid impossible with all the traffic problems

documents.title: fatal fire : fire-fighters forced entry
text: a man has died after a house fire in malvern last night ( and two other men needed treatment for a head injury and the effects of breathing in smoke .
the emergency services were called to `` a severe fire '' at a semi-detached property in malvern at about 21:45 .
hereford & worcester fire and rescue service say they forced entry into the property and rescued the man , but he could not be saved .
the service is now working with police to determine the cause of the fire .

documents.title: rugby : warriors makes four changes
text: team news is in for worcester warriors ' crucial game against bristol on sunday .
the warriors will make four changes .
team news | four changes for warriors ahead of bristol test this sunday .
# coyw
big 23 that !
love the look of this team # coyw

documents.title: blind man 's 'upset ' as uber drives off
text: blind man 's 'upset ' as uber drives off

documents.title: magic moments from fa people 's cup # peoplescup
text: cheeky chips , celebrations and managerial sackings - watch 10 magic moments from the first round of the fa people 's cup

you 'll be able to watch a highlights programme from the first round of the nationwide five-a-side competition on the iplayer from 06:00 gmt saturday , 4 march and on the red button from 14:10 gmt on saturday and throughout the weekend .

documents.title: chaos the cat caught in trap for two weeks
text: meet chaos the cat .
chaos is a rescue cat from hereford who survived for almost two weeks after getting his leg caught in a trap .
chaos , who is 10-years-old , went missing for 13 days before turning up at his bobblestock home with the trap still attached .
he was emaciated , near death and his foot has been paralysed , but he miraculously survived .
the rspca is now trying to find out who set the trap .

documents.title: heart rhythm procedure now on offer at worcester hospital
text: a new procedure is now on offer to worcestershire patients suffering from heart rhythm problems .
the treatment , called cardiac electrophysiology and ablation , was introduced at worcestershire royal hospital this week .
patients previously went to hospitals in coventry and warwickshire for the procedure but can now have it in worcester .
the treatment involves , small wires being placed inside the heart to source the problem and then the area that is causing the arrhythmia is destroyed .

documents.title: first home game for professional netball team
text: a large crowd is expected at the university arena in worcester this evening for the severn stars first-ever home match in netball 's super league .
the stars will take on the celtic dragons in a match which is due to get under way at 19:30 .
severn stars beat their welsh opponents in a pre-season match , but becky oatley , who plays for the stars , told bbc hereford & worcester this will count for little this evening .

documents.title: former consultant says he would rather see hospital shut than face cuts
text: plans to reorganise worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust will leave patients in the north unsafe , and those in the south with a hospital that 's `` woefully inadequate '' , a former consultant claims .
dr santi vathenen , a consultant who worked at the alexandra hospital for more than 20 years , says he 'd rather see it close than see plans to reorganise services there go through .
he 's written .
an open letter to health bosses , urging them to abandon planned changes .
dr vathenen himself left the alexandra hospital in 2015 because of his concerns over patient safety .
a consultation into the changes runs until the end of this month .
the independent chair of the review says only 5 % of patients will be affected by the changes .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: seventh crash in garden in st weonards
text: a st weonards woman is living on her nerves after a succession of motorists have crashed into her roadside garden .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: hospital plan makes care 'less safe '
text: hospital plan makes care 'less safe '

documents.title: sajid javid considers rates discount plan
text: plans to help nearly 100,000 small businesses due to be hit by changes to rates next month are being considered by communities secretary and bromsgrove mp , sajid javid .
out of those , some 25,000 firms face a `` cliff edge '' under the new revaluation of business rates , according to ratings agency cvs .
it presented a number of proposals to mr javid during a meeting on wednesday .
the government is trying to come up with some additional help for small firms after an .
outcry from .
businesses .
ministers have said that the revaluation - the first since 2010 - will mean three-quarters of firms will see their rates stay the same or decrease .
but mr javid and chancellor philip hammond have come under pressure to act to help businesses facing large rises in areas where rental values have increased dramatically .
critics claim the situation favours large retailers and online firms over high street shops .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: work starts on new railway station
text: vegetation is being cleared from a field outside worcester to make way for a new multi-million pound railway station for the city .
workers moved onto the site this week to begin work on the long-awaited worcestershire parkway .
the £ 22m project is due to open at the beginning 2019 , making it easier and quicker for passengers to travel to oxford , bristol , london and birmingham .

documents.title: slurry pollution being investigated
text: we told you earlier about slurry pollution in herefordshire .
the pollution is affecting the tedstone brook , near the river frome .
we 've been in touch with the environment agency who say they are `` investigating the cause of the pollution . ''

the environment agency is looking at possible measures to minimise the impact on the environment and wildlife in and near to the watercourse and will continue to monitor the situation over the coming days .
[ we are ] currently investigating the cause of the pollution .
anyone seeing distressed or dead fish is asked to call the agencies ' 24 hour incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60 .
in the incident room in tewkesbury where we 're coordinating our response to a farm slurry pollution in # herefordshire
oh no !
which river ? from installation or field ?
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: slurry pollution in tewkesbury
text: an incident room has been set up after farm slurry pollution was been discovered in herefordshire .
we 'll bring you more as we get it .
in the incident room in tewkesbury where we 're coordinating our response to a farm slurry pollution in # herefordshire
oh no !
which river ? from installation or field ?

documents.title: rugby : 'discipline key ' says worcester warriors ' director
text: worcester warriors head into sunday 's game against bristol at sixways knowing discipline will be key to success .
director of rugby , gary gold , feels fine margins will determine the outcome of a game between the aviva premiership 's bottom two clubs .
he says warriors need to keep down their penalties conceded count and also ensure they make the most of their attacking opportunities .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: herefordshire council 's hopes for memorial statue
text: hereford 's munitions workers are to have their contributions to ww1 and ww2 recognised , following a campaign by bbc hereford & worcester .
herefordshire council has unanimously passed a motion to honour the canary girls of rotherwas .
the original aim was for a plaque in their memory , but councillors have this morning said they hoped they could `` aim higher and do better '' and build a statue .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: teenager recovering from spine surgery in the usa
text: a teenage girl from herefordshire is recovering in hospital in the usa after a life-changing spinal operation .
ella tomlinson , who 's 14 , had to fly to new jersey to correct severe curvature of the spine in an operation which is n't available on the nhs .
ella 's dad steve told me on the breakfast show that she 's doing well and is hoping to be able to take a few steps later today .
author: Elliott Webb
Breakfast presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: job fair in bromsgrove run by mp sajid javid
text: a jobs fair at the sports hall at north bromsgrove high school from 10:00 is being hosted by sajid javid , the mp for bromsgrove and secretary of state for communities and local government
i 'll be opening my # bromsgrovejobsfair in less than 2 hours !
over 55 firms with over 1700 jobs !

documents.title: breakingcouncil will honour rotherwas munitions workers
text: herefordshire council has unanimously passed the motion to honour the rotherwas munitions workers .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: multi-million pound scheme to protect homes against flooding
text: a £ 4m scheme designed to protect more than 300 worcestershire homes from flooding will begin this summer .
the flood storage area , which will be built in broadway , will be able to hold 135 million litres of rain water .
it will protect properties in broadway , childswickham and murcot .
in 2007 the area was hit by severe flooding .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: 'totally unacceptable ' to refuse blind man a taxi says uber
text: the taxi service uber has held its hands up and apologised after a blind man said the company refused his service 14 times because he has a guide dog .
in a statement , uber said : `` it 's totally unacceptable for drivers to refuse to take a guide dog .
`` licensed private hire drivers must carry service animals in their vehicle and we remind all drivers of this legal obligation before they start using the uber app .
`` any driver who is found to have refused to take a service animal will permanently lose access to the uber app and risks having their private hire licence taken away .
`` the two drivers complained about by mr ahmed have been barred from using the app and wo n't be allowed back if the complaint is upheld . ''
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: fatal house fire in malvern
text: a man has died after a house fire in malvern last night ( and two other men needed treatment for a head injury and the effects of breathing in smoke .
the ambulance service says they were called to belmont road in malvern just before 21:50 on 2 march .
a man was rescued from the house but later died at the scene , a spokesman said .

documents.title: uber drivers refused to take guide dog
text: uber drivers refused to take guide dog

documents.title: family-run book shop up for award
text: a family-run shop in herefordshire has been short-listed for the independent bookseller of the year award .
rossiter books , who have stores in ross-on-wye and monmouth , is run by andy and victoria rossiter and organises regular author talks and runs local book clubs .
the winner will be announced at the british book awards in london in may .

documents.title: taxi service refuses to take blind man
text: a blind man who works in worcester says he 's been repeatedly let down by uber drivers who 've refused to take him 14 times since he got a guide dog two and a half years ago .
sal ahmed says he 's complained to uber about one particular driver who 's refused him four times in a row because of his dog .
uber are investigating , but in the meantime , sal says his journey from new street station to his home in birmingham has become a nightmare .
uber say it is `` totally unacceptable '' for drivers to refuse to take a guide dog .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: rain moving in this morning means it will be a thoroughly wet day with lots of showers and highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire local live
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but local stories will be added automatically through the night .

documents.title: herefordshire teenager undergoing major surgery in us
text: a 14-year-old from herefordshire is now undergoing major spinal surgery in the states after her parents raised £ 140,000 to pay for it .
ella tomlinson , who lives in leominster , has severe curvature of the spine , which seriously impairs her mobility and her ability to enjoy her love of sports .
the family flew to new jersey at the weekend as the treatment ella needs is n't available on the nhs .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: redditch residents warned over storm scam warning
text: redditch residents are being warned not to fall victim to scams being carried out by bogus callers offering to repair any damage caused by last week 's storm doris .
author: Redditch Standard

documents.title: watch : your 50-second overnight weather forecast
text: apart from a little showery rain , it should be dry this evening and for much of the night with clear spells .
however , it will turn cloudier towards dawn with some rain reaching southwestern parts , with lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow , after a dry start in the north , the rain in the south will spread to all parts through the morning .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: top wheelchair basketball teams to descend on worcester
text: the university of worcester arena is to host some of the world 's top wheelchair basketball teams in june .

the venue is hosting the men 's and women 's continental clash - a four-day event which will see british sides face international competition as they begin preparations for tournaments up to and including the tokyo 2020 paralym

documents.title: west mercia experiencing phone problems
text: calls to 999 are n't affected .
currently experiencing issues with non emergency calls-it are working to resolve asap .
in an emergency , as always , call on 999 hh
update-it issues now resolved .
thank you .
hh

documents.title: 'more help ' for struggling businesses promised by mp
text: the bromsgrove mp and communities secretary , sajid javid , says more help is on the way for companies who face a steep rise in their business rates .
it follows claims by the federation of small businesses that a third of its members expect their rates to go up when a revaluation comes into effect in april .
speaking ahead of the third annual bromsgrove job fair tomorrow , mr javid has told bbc hereford & worcester the government is `` listening to feedback '' .
author: Andrew Easton
Presenter, BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: travel : high water levels at drakes broughton ford
text: a reminder from the contractors who work on worcestershire 's road about how flood water can make fords impassable .
current situation at drakes broughton ford

documents.title: work to start on flood relief for villages
text: almost 300 homes and businesses in worcestershire are set to benefit from a new £ 4m flood defence scheme .
work to build a flood storage area in broadway will start in the summer and benefit the nearby villages of childswickham and murcot .
the money has been raised by a number of local councils in conjunction with the environment agency .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: work under way on new worcester railway station
text: work has started on a new railway station for worcester .
the worcestershire parkway regional interchange , to give the station its full title , got the official stamp of approval from the department for transport in january .
workers have now begun clearing the site at norton .
author: Claudia Berry
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: man aged 80 dies after car overturns
text: an 80-year-old man has died after the car he was driving overturned in chaddesley corbett , police say .
west mercia police say the blue renault clio was being driven on woodrow lane at about 09:50 today when it is thought to have left the road and overturned .
the driver died at the scene .
an appeal has been launched by west mercia police .
for witnesses .
author: West Mercia Police

documents.title: watch : wolves already planning for next season
text: worcester wolves ' head coach , paul james , says the planning for next season is already underway .
the wolves started this season with only ashton khan remaining from the 2015-16 roster and the coach is keen to keep the nucleus of this squad together if at all possible .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: slideshow : sunshine lights up the countryside
text: the bbc 's army of weather watchers have been busy getting some great photos as the sun breaks through to light up the countryside .
these come from ricardo , mikesnapper , j at severn ridge , toppo and the wolster .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: third teenager arrested following criminal damage spree to cars in malvern
text: a third teenager has been arrested on sus of causing criminal damage following a trail of destruction to car wing mirrors in malvern .
author: Malvern Observer

documents.title: eleven bid for city of culture title
text: eleven bid for city of culture title

documents.title: 20 drivers caught using their phones at the wheel since law change
text: west mercia police has caught 20 drivers using their phones at the wheel since yesterday 's change in the law .
penalties doubled from wednesday in england , wales and scotland , with offenders receiving a £ 200 fine and six penalty points - new drivers could also lose their licence for a single offence .

documents.title: hundreds of parents fined for failing to strap their children into cars properly
text: latest figures show that in the last six years west mercia police handed out 236 fines to parents who failed to strap their children into cars properly .
a change in the law on child car seats came into effect yesterday .
experts from the transport research laboratory claim around two thirds of children are not strapped in safely .

documents.title: owner of stolen land rover fears theft will hit his business
text: a landscape architect , whose land rover defender was stolen on monday night , says he fears for the future of his business without the vehicle .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: bromsgrove coach hopes to share his idea for 'walking hockey '
text: a worcestershire hockey coach is hoping to share his ideas for a new version of the sport in countries on the other side of the world .
bromsgrove hockey club is one of the first in the uk to be teaching people to play walking hockey , which is targeted at people over the age of 40 .
the club 's head of development , alan gormley , has been invited to meet with associations in australia , new zealand and dubai to discuss how to make the game popular overseas .

documents.title: police appeal for worcester man wanted on warrant
text: a 32-year-old worcester man is being sought by .
west mercia police .
after failing to appear in court .
andrew cornes , of no fixed abode , failed to appear at worcester crown court on 28 january , to answer a charge of assault , police say .
author: West Mercia Police

documents.title: police stop dozens of drivers using their phones at the wheel on the first day of double fines
text: more than 50 motorists were stopped by the central motorway police group ( cmpg ) for using hand-held mobiles at the wheel yesterday .
penalties doubled from wednesday in england , wales and scotland , with .
offenders receiving a £ 200 fine and six penalty points .
- new drivers could also lose their licence for a single offence .
the cmpg is made up of officers and staff from west midlands , west mercia and staffordshire police forces .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: hereford bidding to become the uk city of culture in 2021
text: hereford is among 11 towns and cities to put their name forward to become uk city of culture in 2021 .
perth , paisley , stoke , sunderland and coventry had already put themselves up for the accolade when they declared their interest last year .
five more have now put their hats into the ring : warrington , portsmouth , wells , swansea and the smallest city in britain , st david 's .
the chosen place .
will succeed hull , which is the city of culture for 2017 .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: watch : mystery driver up wallet containing an 'entire month 's takings '
text: a redditch businessman is appealing for help finding a woman driver who up a wallet containing £ 1,600 .
clive fokes , who runs courtyard music in tardebigge , dropped the wallet as he loaded something into the boot of his car - the mystery motorist then pulled in and it up .
the wallet contained his entire takings for a month , as well as his credit cards and driving licence .
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: £ 10,000 fund to bring down running costs at worcester 's guildhall
text: a £ 10,000 fund to explore energy-saving ideas at worcester 's guildhall has been drawn up by council chiefs .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: man dies while on gym treadmill
text: a man has died after having a heart attack whilst he was on the treadmill at hereford leisure centre , the ambulance service say .
west midlands ambulance service were called to the centre in holmer road just before 07:00 yesterday morning after the man had become ill while training .
leisure centre staff and paramedics carried out cpr on the man but he died shortly after he arrived at hereford county hospital , a spokesman said .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: plans to make new road a venue where there 's 'always something on '
text: the ceo of worcestershire county cricket club , tom scott , says he 's keen to see the side 's new road home stage more events in the future .
the ground is already hosting an olly murs concert in june , a classical orchestra in august and a `` legends '' gig , featuring billy ocean , in september .
mr scott says it 's all part of a `` longer term '' strategy to convert the cricket club into a `` 365 days a year '' business .

documents.title: rugby : warriors must keep things 'simple ' to win crunch bristol tie
text: worcester warriors ' director of rugby , gary gold , has spoken of the importance of a good result in their vital premiership game at the weekend .
the struggling side are preparing to take on bristol , who are only two points below them at the bottom of the table .
gold says by concentrating on a `` simple plan '' his team will be able to deal with the pressure of sunday 's game .

documents.title: west mercia 's crime investigations 'require improvement ' says watchdog
text: west mercia police has been told to `` work harder '' to investigate crimes , especially when victims are n't keen to press charges .
while the force received an overall rating of .
`` good '' , her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary ( hmic ) says the needs to raise standards for crime prevention and the investigation of serious and organised crime .
west mercia says it is working hard to address areas which require improvement .
what [ west mercia ] needs to do is to build on the positive practice that it has already put in place by ensuring that officers look at all possible lines of inquiry . ''

documents.title: new homes 'unaffordable ' for nine out of 10 in west midlands
text: about nine out of every 10 families in the west midlands are unable to afford newly built homes in their local area , a report by housing charity shelter says .
its research shows rising house prices are hitting all parts of england , not just london and the south east .
in the west midlands , 93 % of privately renting working families could not afford to buy a newly built home , even if they used the government 's help to buy scheme , the charity says .
in the region , the average price of a new home was £ 206,950 .
the charity wants to see a new style of building , modelled on that of victorian philanthropists , where short-term profits are replaced by `` long-term community gains '' .
ministers agree the system is broken and want to make housing affordable .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: your ideas wanted for new library design
text: people in hereford are being asked to share their ideas and designs for a new multi-million pound library , museum and learning centre in the city .
campaigners are hoping to secure £ 9m of national funding to transform the current site in broad street and will be submitting their ideas in may .

documents.title: world book day : malvern 's narnia connection
text: cs lewis , who wrote the narnia books , was a teacher at malvern college .
the town 's famous gas lamps are said to have inspired key scenes in the books .
happy # worldbookday !
did you know c.s lewis attended # malvern college ?
gas lamps in # narnia possibly inspired from # greatmalvern !

documents.title: hospital trust will 'struggle ' to recruit nurses
text: the director of a firm which recruits nurses nationally says the the wye valley nhs trust will struggle to recruit because it 's such a rural area .
the trust which runs herefordshire 's hospitals has spent £ 8m between april of last year and january of this year on agency nursing staff .
about 130 full-time nursing posts are currently vacant and plans are being put in place to recruit 60 new nurses from europe , but that will cost about £ 900,000 .
rowland sheen , from t f s healthcare , says the trust needs to find ways of making the area more appealing for new nurses .

documents.title: weather : chance of showers this morning but clearing through the day
text: windy at first with some early morning sunshine likely in the south .
there will be a little rain perhaps in the north for a time , this will clear to allow plenty of sunshine across the region by the afternoon .
winds will ease through the day with highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .

or message via .
facebook .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for today 's live updates from the hereford & worcester newsroom .
we 'll be back at 8:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport and weather .

documents.title: baby boom for west midland safari park staff
text: it was n't just the animals at .
west midland safari park .
that experienced a baby boom over the past 12 months .
eight members of staff at the park were preparing for their very own special arrivals - all within a year of each other .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: watch : your 50-second overnight weather forecast
text: it will turn windy with showers through the evening , giving some heavy bursts at times .
the rain will linger through the early hours , mainly in northern parts , turning to snow over higher ground and perhaps settling in a few places - lows of 2c ( 36f ) .
tomorrow , any rain will linger for some at first on thursday .
however , it will clear through the morning .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : bulls striker injury 'not as serious ' as first feared
text: hereford fc manager pete beadle says he 's confident jamie cuss 's knee injury is not as serious as was initially feared .
the bulls striker was playing for pegasus juniors when he suffered an apparent recurrence of the problem - but is now undergoing rehabilitation following further scans .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: public consultation launched on plans for a community sports stadium
text: a 21-day public consultation is under way on worcester city football club 's revised plans for a community sports facility at perdiswell .
the application is for a floodlit football stadium along with a separate all-weather 3g pitch .
author: Simon Glover
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: watch : camera-wearing dean flips pancakes around cathedral in annual race
text: footage of the dean of worcester cathedral competing in the annual pancake race has been viewed thousands of times online .
the video was filmed by the very reverend peter atkinson as he completed a number of obstacles whilst flipping a pancake .
people lined the hallowed halls to see the annual event take place yesterday .
author: Simon Glover
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: hereford sixth form college is first to be converted to academy status
text: hereford sixth form college is the first of its kind in the country to be converted to academy status .
it follows a successful campaign to give colleges the right to convert to academies , making them exempt from vat costs .
dr jonathan godfrey - the head teacher at hereford sixth form college - says the money that 'll be saved by the change will be used to benefit the students .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: celebrity chef to headline droitwich spa food and drink festival
text: a television chef has been announced as the headline act at a popular food and drink festival .
brian turner cbe will officially open this year 's .
droitwich spa food and drink festival .
on saturday , june 17 .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: police commissioner says west mercia being left behind by technology
text: the police force has n't kept up with technology , according to the police and crime commissioner for west mercia police .
john campion pointed out that `` even the bbc '' uses smartphones and tablets these days and wants to spend millions of pounds equipping his officers with new technology .
mr campion said `` we need to be the kind of organisation which uses technology to improve our service '' and the force needed to plan ahead better , so it is n't left behind again .
i think part of the police 's problem is that the advent of mobile technology has passed them by .
they have n't seen it coming .

documents.title: can `` bed blocking '' be unblocked ?
text: can `` bed blocking '' be unblocked ?
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: your thoughts : chicken nugget appeal for eight-year-old autistic boy
text: we told you yesterday about an eight-year-old boy from malvern who will only eat birds eye chicken nuggets .
the recipe has recently been changed and , due to his condition , william stocker wo n't eat the new version of nuggets .
william 's parents are now appealing for help to source the 'old ' version of the nuggets .
on the bbc midlands today facebook page , plenty of you have been getting in touch with your thoughts .
valentina carmela roberts .
sympathized : `` i can only imagine the meal time hell they are going through .
fingers crossed they get the help and support they need for their little one and things improve for them . ''
allison matthews .
says : `` is n't it the parents responsibility to provide proper food which also includes fruit and veg ?
there 's got to be a way to transition this child to those as well . ''
author: Simon Glover
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: council tax to rise in bromsgrove
text: council tax across the district of bromsgrove will go up by an average of 2.5 % this year .
the final part of the increase was approved by councillors in the town last night .
altogether rises from county , district and parish councils , as well as precepts for police and fire services , will see a band d property paying £ 33 more a year .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: tasers drawn on children nearly 50 times in four years
text: tasers have been drawn or aimed at children 48 times by west mercia police officers over the past four years , 12 in 2016 alone .
in one incident this involved a 10-year-old child , but the taser was not fired .
on 38 of those occasions the taser was aimed at the child but not fired , and on eight occasions the taser was drawn from its holster , but not aimed .
they were only used to give an electric shock twice .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Online

documents.title: cricket : club considering 'selling off ' naming rights to home ground
text: worcestershire county cricket club say they 're looking at the option of selling off the naming rights to their new road home .
the management says the club is an ideal location for a company seeking worldwide exposure .
the club 's ceo tom scott has said the name new road would remain part of any new name if a deal is struck with a potential sponsor .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: over 100 comment on constituency change plans
text: about 100 shropshire people have had their say so far on proposed changes to parliamentary constituencies which could see the county having to share one of its seats with herefordshire .
the boundary commission for england has published all the submissions so far on its website this morning and you have until the end of march to take part in the consultation .
the proposals would create a new `` ludlow and leominster '' seat and move bridgnorth in with the wrekin constituency .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: mother of tunisia terror victim 'glad ' the inquest into the 30 british deaths is over
text: the mother of a student at the university of worcester , murdered in the tunisia beach attack in 2015 , says she 's glad the inquest into the 30 british deaths is over .
joel richards was 19 when he was killed by a gunman in the resort of sousse .
his mum suzy evans says it 's been a 'long seven weeks ' .
earlier we reported that a man from kidderminster , who survived the attack , says he would be `` too afraid '' to go back to tunisia .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: police to spend millions on smartphones and laptops
text: smartphones and laptops could help west mercia police officers spend an extra hour on the beat every day , the police and crime commissioner has said .
john campion and his counterpart in warwickshire are planning to spend more than £ 4m on techology to allow officers file reports and do other admin on the move instead of returning to base .
the force says trials in other parts of the region got a positive response from officers there .

documents.title: police appeal for man with links to redditch wanted on warrant
text: west mercia police is appealing for help to trace 42-year-old nicholas hickman , of no fixed abode .

hickman , who 's described as about 5ft 11in tall and of slim build , is currently wanted on warrant after failing to appear at kidderminster magistrates ' court on 7 february in connection with a theft from a shop and handling stolen goods in redditch .
author: West Mercia Police

documents.title: rugby : worcester warriors flanker could face a suspension
text: worcester flanker phil dowson could face a suspension after being charged with elbowing northampton 's ken pisi in the head .
dowson will appear before a rugby football union disciplinary panel tonight over the alleged incident during the warrior 's 24-14 loss at northampton on saturday .

documents.title: campaigners call for lower speed limit on 'dangerous ' road
text: campaigners are calling for the speed limit on bringsty common near bromyard to be lowered to 30mph as they say it 's an accident waiting to happen .
the a44 is currently 50mph but nearby residents say drivers regularly speed on the road and do n't slow down for bends .
farmers are also concerned about their sheep being killed while grazing .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: air ambulance unveils sculpture to mark 25th anniversary
text: the .
midlands air ambulance .
charity has unveiled a 20ft ( 6m ) high sculpture to mark its 25th anniversary .
the air pulse memorial will be on display near norton canes services on the m6 toll in staffordshire .
since it was set up in 1991 , midlands air ambulance helicopters have responded to over 47,000 incidents .

documents.title: rugby : matt cox signs a new warriors deal
text: worcester warriors have announced redditch-born flanker matt cox has signed a new contract to remain at sixways .
breaking news warriors are delighted to reveal that @ twitterid has signed a new deal with the club .
great news matt !
congrats matt
so why the long face @ twitterid
awesome ol chap ! !
x
- the ticket office ladies are over the at this news - # oneofourfavourites
congratulations coxy .
see you in the gym !

documents.title: appeal to find man 's 'beloved ' van continues
text: a morris 1000 van stolen from a home in cheltenham has been spotted in both malvern and worcester , the owners claim .
the vehicle , described as turquoise blue with 'r d haidon horticultural engineer ' written on its side and rear doors , is the subject of a facebook campaign .
hereford & worcester 's malcolm boyden and his team have joined the efforts to track the van down .
watch !
have you seen this van ?
malcolm boyden has joined @ twitterid campaign to # findthetincan .
can you help ?
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: calls for a rethink on plans to shake up constituency boundaries
text: local politicians and residents from across the two counties are calling for a rethink on plans to shake-up the boundaries of parliamentary constituencies .
efforts to reduce the number of mps at westminster would see residents in north herefordshire sharing a representative with part of shropshire .
droitwich would share an mp with bromsgrove , while the same would happened in malvern and ledbury .
ledbury town council says such a change would mean two communities with no `` common affiliation '' would be stuck together .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: hospital bosses meeting to discuss changes to care
text: hospital bosses in worcestershire will meet this morning to discuss changes to care .
worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust has until next friday to demonstrate improvements to the quality and safety of its services - or face further sanctions by the care quality commission .
the latest figures for january reveal 167 patients had to wait for more than 12 hours for treatment at a & e .

documents.title: your a view from the river severn
text: weather watcher mikesnapper took these two lovely in worcester .
the first is of `` some welcome afternoon sunshine and partly blue skies over the river severn , seen from the diglis bridge '' .
and the second is `` sunshine over the river severn with the landmark of st andrew 's spire reflected in the water '' .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: malvern duo create charity song for refugee crisis in middle east
text: a musician and a poet , both from malvern , have released a song for charity to show their support for those caught up in the refugee crisis in the middle east .
author: Malvern Observer

documents.title: football : kidderminster harriers ' title hopes suffer blow
text: kidderminster harriers ' hopes of winning vanarama north this season suffered a setback last night when they were beaten 2-0 at brackley town .
the home side scored twice in the last eight minutes to consign harriers to their second defeat in their last three league matches .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: teenager in 'good spirits ' ahead of major surgery in us
text: the parents of a herefordshire teenager say nerves are building ahead of her spinal surgery in the us tomorrow .
ella tomlinson , 14 , from leominster has severe curvature of the spine .
her family have chosen to fly her to the us because the operation is no longer available on the nhs .
ella 's dad steve says his daughter is in `` good spirits '' ahead of the procedure - the trip expenses and operation are costing the family about £ 140,000 .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: tunisia terror attack survivor 'will never visit that part of the world again '
text: a man who was on the beach at the time of the tunisia terror attack in 2015 says he 'll never visit that part of the world again .

it comes after the coroner yesterday delivered his conclusions at the inquests into the deaths of 30 british tourists in sousse - describing the police response to the attack as `` at best shambolic and at worst cowardly '' .
matt preece , from kidderminster , says he felt very vulnerable during the attack and would be too afraid to go back to the resort .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch the latest forecast : a bright start but we may see showers later
text: a bright start across the west midlands this morning , with perhaps an isolated shower for some .
the skies will slowly cloud over through the morning , with patchy rain likely to arrive from the south west during the late afternoon , with highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: follow our coverage throughout the day
text: we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across herefordshire and worcestershire .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: feasibility study for worcester footbridge
text: a new footbridge could be built in worcester to try to reduce congestion and improve links with the northern part of the city .
the conservative group at the city council are pushing the idea forward and a £ 150,000 feasibility study has been agreed .
the bridge would link gheluvelt park to kepax country park , just off the hallow road .

documents.title: coming up on midlands today : the need for birds eye chicken nuggets
text: i 've been to meet the eight-year-old worcestershire boy who is refusing to eat virtually any food after birds eye changed the recipe of its chicken nuggets .
william stocker , from malvern , who is autistic , used to eat 150 nuggets a week , but says he wo n't eat the new version .
his parents are appealing for the company to go back to the original recipe .
see my report .
on bbc1 from 18:30 .
author: Tom Turrell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: wildlife trust dealing with aftermath of storm doris
text: although storm doris is nothing but a distant nightmare for some , for others the after effects are still being felt .
the worcestershire wildlife trust are busy counting number of trees who felt the wrath of doris .
counting the damage from # stormdoris last week - poor old pear tree in # orchard at # hollybedfarmmeadows
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: eastenders star shane richie furious after malvern lounge turns him away for wearing a hat
text: an eastenders star was turned away from a bar in malvern for wearing a hat .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: nhs whistleblower to appeal at high court
text: an nhs whistleblower from worcestershire who was struck off for working while off sick is to appeal the decision in the high court .
radiographer ken hall claimed he was the victim of a witch hunt , after raising concerns about thousands of un-examined x-rays at the county 's acute hospitals .
mr hall was banned from working by an industry tribunal back in december , after he took on shifts for a private company while on sick leave .
mr hall claims he 'd only earned £ 90 , and offered to pay it back , but the health and care professionals council ruled he 'd misled his employer .
he is now hoping to appeal the decision at the high court next month .
an online fundraising campaign has been started to ensure he has legal representation .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: man suffers 'fractured pelvis ' after car crash
text: a man has been taken to hospital with a suspected fractured pelvis after a car crashed into him , police say .
the man , who is in his 70s , has `` life changing '' but not `` life threatening '' injuires .
west mercia police is appealing for information of the incident that happened around 21:30 on 24 february , outside the talbot hotel in leominster .

documents.title: your cleeve prior and doddenham
text: this lovely was snapped by bbc weather watcher .
vicki 's view .
these clouds look rather ominous , taken in doddenham , by bbc weather watche r toppo .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: serious injuries for cyclist involved in crash
text: a man in his 60s suffered serious injuries after a car crashed into a cyclist .
west mercia police are appealing for witnesses and information to the collision that happened on sillins avenue , redditch .
the driver of a light coloured vauxhall astra van failed to stop at the scene , police say .
police have renewed their appeal to the incident , which happened on 13 december .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: worcester set for a new footbridge across the river severn
text: worcester could get a new bridge across the river severn - in an exciting bid to ease congestion and get more people walking .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: rugby : warriors sign wasps winger
text: worcester warriors have signed wasps academy winger tom howe ahead of the 2017/18 season .

speaking to the worcester warriors website , tom howe said : `` i 'd like to thank wasps for the opportunities they have given me during my time in the academy but i 'm now looking forward to a new chapter .
`` i 'm looking forward to joining in the summer and hopefully i can make the same progress as some of those young guys and compete for a place in the first-team . ''
breaking news warriors confirm the signing of exciting young winger @ twitterid from wasps .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: breakingdeal struck over bhs pension scheme
text: sir philip green has agreed a £ 363m cash settlement with the pensions regulator to plug the gap in the bhs pension scheme .
workers will get the same starting pension that they were originally promised under the agreement .

it brings to a close a long-running negotiation over benefits for former workers of the collapsed retailer , which had outlets in birmingham city centre , wolverhampton , walsall , redditch , sutton coldfield , coventry , warwickshire , hanley , telford and the merry hill centre in brierley hill .
the regulator had launched enforcement action against sir philip and other former owners of bhs .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: travel : gritters out as temperatures drop
text: you can find out which roads have been gritted using the online maps produced by .
herefordshire council .
and .
worcestershire county council .
scattered showers & road temps down to -1c - we 'll be gritting overnight with timing tbc depending on rainfall - take care # grittertwitter
@ twitterid now i 'm singing `` do you wan na be in my gang '' which is never a good thing !
careful
i know i know
ha ha grittertwitter !
love it

documents.title: statue stolen from inside church
text: this resin statue has been stolen from inside st luke 's church in stoke prior , herefordshire .
it has only been in place since october .
hereford & worcester presenter malcolm boyden is joining the quest to help track it down .
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: your thoughts : chicken nugget appeal for eight-year-old autistic boy
text: we told you earlier about an eight-year-old boy from malvern who will only eat birds eye chicken nuggets .
the recipe has recently been changed and , due to his condition , william stocker wo n't eat the new version of nuggets .
william 's parents are appealing for help to source the 'old ' version of the nuggets .
on the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page , you have been getting in touch with your thoughts .
heather carty .
said : `` i feel for you , my son has a fear of trying new foods and has almost lived off uncle ben 's s mexican rice .
he wo n't eat in front of people he does n't know .
hope you find the nuggets ! ''
pat tunley .
sympathized : `` food phobia is hard to break .
it 's very hard if a child has it .
good luck . ''
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: fly-tippers block road in hartlebury
text: fly-tippers have left a lane near hartlebury totally blocked this morning .
a load of tree cuttings have been dumped just off crown lane near the trading estate .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: your abbey meadows
text: paul wilde has been out for a wander at abbey meadows in redditch and has snapped some fantastic
the first he says is of `` altocumulus clouds '' - it was only 4c ( 39f ) .
this next one is of a `` young thrush singing '' .
if you have any you 'd like to share , you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : harriers in away trip to afc fylde
text: kidderminster harriers are back in action this evening as they head to brackley town for their vanarama north game .
harriers need a win this evening if they are to keep up the pressure on league leaders , afc fylde .
the club 's head of coaching , matt gardiner , says they wo n't change their approach just because they are on the road .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : pancake race around the cathedral
text: here 's a participant 's eye view of the annual pancake race around the cloisters at worcester cathedral .
the camera was strapped to the dean .

documents.title: officers wearing body cameras costs over £ 12,000
text: councils in herefordshire and worcestershire have now spent more than £ 12,000 on giving their employees body-worn cameras .

figures complied by the privacy campaign group big brother watch show that 56 cameras are now used by local authorities in tasks such as protecting staff from aggressive behaviour or filming the public littering or committing parking offences .
the highest user so far is worcester city council , which has 29 cameras .
it 's been criticised by .
big brother watch .
for keeping the recordings for more than a year .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: breakingtunisia inquest : victims 'unlawfully killed '
text: the police response to a terror attack at a tunisian resort in which 30 britons were killed was `` at best shambolic and at worst cowardly '' , a coroner has concluded .
in all , 38 people were killed when an islamist gunman opened fire at a hotel in sousse on 26 june 2015 .
judge nicholas loraine-smith said he would rule that all 30 britons were `` unlawfully killed '' .
one of the victims was university of worcester student joel richards , who was 19 .

documents.title: deadline approaching on new constituency plans
text: around 100 shropshire people have had their say so far on new parliamentary constituencies which could see shropshire having to share one of its seats with herefordshire .
the boundary commission for england has published all the submissions so far on its website .
you 've got until the end of march to take part in the consultation .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: appeal to find man 's 'beloved ' van
text: a morris 1000 van , stolen from the owners ' home in shurdington , cheltenham , has been seen in both malvern and worcester in the last 48 hours , the owners claim .
the owners ' son is from eckington , worcestershire and has released of the van on social media .
in a post , on .
find my dad 's morris van , the vehicle is described as turquoise blue and has 'r d haidon horticultural engineer ' written on its sides and rear doors .
it has been described as `` no ordinary van '' and was `` my dad 's trusty steed '' .
the family are desperate to get the van back - if you can help , you can get in touch with the facebook appeal page here .
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: 'happy van ' wins toyota dream car award
text: a five-year-old from hereford has won a competition hosted by toyota where entrants must design their dream car .
cecile catchpole , from hereford won the under-eight category with her entry called the happy van .
the happy van is `` a machine whose principle purpose is to cheer people up .
it can fly , tell jokes , sing songs , share out sweets and scatter fairy glitter while travelling along a rainbow road '' .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: rugby : worcester warriors preparing for sunday 's big game
text: worcester warriors ' director of rugby , gary gold , says there 's no getting away from the fact sunday 's home match against bristol is a massive game .
bristol 's win over bath on sunday means there are now only two points between warriors and bristol , who are bottom of the aviva premiership table .
gary gold says they 'll be working hard to ensure they get the preparations just right .

documents.title: wellington shop and post office beats hundreds to win 'rural oscar '
text: a shopkeeper who `` just wants to make people happy '' .
has beaten hundreds of others to win a rural oscar .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: malvern family appeals for chicken nuggets for their eight-year-old autistic son
text: an eight-year-old boy with autism from worcestershire is refusing to eat virtually any food after birds eye changed the recipe of its chicken nuggets .
due to his condition , william stocker from malvern , who used to eat 150 nuggets a week , now says he wo n't eat the new version .
the only other foods he eats are cake and jelly .
his parents are appealing for the company to go back to the original recipe .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: your ashton-under-hill
text: weather watcher morning amble took this lovely photo in ashton-under-hill , worcestershire .
it 's the last day of meteorological winter after all , and you can tell !
if you have a you 'd like to share , you can sign up and become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: tunisia terror inquest : coroner rules on death of worcester student
text: the coroner at the inquests into the deaths of the british tourists who were murdered in a terror attack in tunisia two years ago , including a worcester student , .
will deliver his conclusions this morning .

thirty-eight people , including thirty britons , among them joel richards , a student at the university of worcester , died when a gunman opened fire on holidaymakers at a hotel in sousse , in june 2015 .
a judge at the royal courts of justice will explain why he 's rejected a request from the bereaved families to rule that neglect by a travel firm was a factor .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: allegations of abuse made in herefordshire
text: more than 300 allegations of abuse have been made against carers working in people 's homes across herefordshire in the past three years .
a freedom of information request made by the bbc found from 2013 to 2016 a total of 311 safeguarding alerts were reported .
however , none resulted in prosecutions .
nearly half of all allegations were over neglect .
herefordshire council says it has robust processes in place to deal with any concerns .
the department of health says it has introduced tougher inspections of care services .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: watch : a chilly start to the day with rain to come
text: there 's a yellow weather warning for ice this morning , so expect a chilly start with showers expected later - highs of 7c ( 44f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from local live for herefordshire and worcestershire
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store tonight ?
text: a chilly night is expected , with some showers turning icy into the early hours and lows of -1 ( 30f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: celebrity doodles to help children with life-limiting illnesses
text: celebrities including ed sheeran , peter andre and miranda hart have doodled and painted to help raise money for the ombersley charity , the anna wilkinson mockingbird trust .
chris and wendy wilkinson , together with their daughters jessica and elizabeth , set up the new charity after their youngest daughter , anna , died aged 16 of a brain tumour .
the trust will arrange trips and events for children with life-limiting illnesses and their families .
anna touched [ more ] people in 16 years [ than ] some people touch in a whole lifetime .
she was beautiful , intelligent , passionate , compassionate everyone she met she loved and they loved her . ''
the doodles will be auctioned at the charity 's official launch in june .
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: gps 'need better training to spot eating disorders ' says sufferer
text: a redditch mum who has had an eating disorder for most her life says gps need better training to spot the signs .
it comes after a report published by beat the charity shows that three out of 10 people with the illness did not receive a referral to a mental health service once they had seen their gp .
nikki petrie , aged 50 , says she was only diagnosed six years ago and her family have coped with her `` refusing food and being very deceptive about what food she was eating '' .
author: Michele Paduano
Health correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: blackpole munitions factory anniversary : 'the best part was the spam and chips '
text: former staff from the blackpole munitions factory have been reminiscing about their war-time work , during an event to mark the 100th anniversary of it opening in worcester .
the factory produced 200 million bullets in two years during world war one and returned to production during world war two .
one of the hundreds of those employed at the factory - many of them women - was kath smith .
it was dirty and noisy , but the harder your worked , the more money you got .
the best part was the spam and chips we had once a week .
well they were quite a luxury in those days . ''
the event also included the launch of a new book , blackpole munitions factory , worcester , by the late colin jones .
it is now blackpole east industrial estate .

documents.title: burglars steal stock worth thousands from businesses
text: thousands of pounds worth of stock was stolen from two struggling businesses in rubery on saturday , just months after they were left devastated by a fire .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: travel : roads being gritted as temperatures drop
text: you can find out which roads have been gritted using the online maps produced by .
herefordshire council .
and .
worcestershire county council .
road temps down to -2c tonight - we will be gritting # worcs roads after showers become more isolated , expected approx 9pm # grittertwitter
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: historic malvern stately home featured in literary trail
text: a. historic family home in malvern has been included in a new online literary trail , because of its links to the 20th century novelist , evelyn waugh .
the imaginary house in one of his most famous books , .
brideshead revisited , was partly modelled on madrefield court , which the author visited on many occasions .
the house is the ancestral home of the lygon family , who were the inspiration for many of the characters in the novel .
it 's no surprise that so many historic houses association member houses have links to literary heroes of the past - from william shakespeare to jane austen .
what is less well-known is that some of our members ' houses remain the lived-in homes of authors today , who draw inspiration from the beauty of their surroundings . ''
2017 has been named the year of literary heroes '' by visit england .

documents.title: icy forecast for tomorrow 's rush hour
text: drivers are being warned to expect tricky conditions during rush hour tomorrow morning by the met office , with icy weather set to last into tuesday .
there have already been snow showers today in parts of the region and the met office says there 'll be more tonight - it has issued a yellow weather warning .
forecasters say temperatures could dip below freezing point and there could be snow over hills .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket in herefordshire : future changes to be revealed
text: cricketers and officials from across herefordshire will tonight find out how the sport will be run within the county in the future .
there have been major changes at all levels of the game in recent months and tonight 's meeting will seek to iron out issues between the various groups .
the marches league are doing a very good job of the league cricket and local league cricket .
but there does have to be this joined up thinking .
we 've got to work together and understand all aspects of cricket from the top to the bottom really . ''
the meeting at the railway club on barton road is due to start at 19:30 .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: trains cancelled at kidderminster
text: london midland say travellers to and from kidderminster are being affected by a faulty train .
the 16:23 kidderminster to stratford-upon-avon will be started from birmingham snow hill instead , and the 15:09 dorridge to kidderminster was terminated at birmingham snow hill .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: elton john tribute act mark ruck jailed for five years
text: an elton john tribute act has been cleared of attempted murder but jailed for grievous bodily harm after a knife attack on his parents .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: police 'encouraged ' that more men are reporting domestic violence
text: west mercia police says it is .
encouraged that more male victims of domestic abuse are coming forward , after the man kind charity revealed the number of reported cases has gone up from 750 in 2012 to 2,000 in 2015 .
the charity estimates only a third of incidents are reported .
the force say it has established three harm assessment units where specialist staff provide support to victims of both genders and ensure information is passed on to partner agencies .
domestic violence and abuse is under-reported and we are encouraged that more men are reporting these crimes .
our aim is to give people the confidence to come forward in the knowledge that a full investigation will be carried out and they will be supported . ''
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: rock band queen : fine-art photos come to worcester
text: worcester is to host an exhibition of fine-art photographs of the rock band queen .

the bmw showroom in wainwright road will be transformed into an art gallery on the evening of 28 september , as the exhibition `` princes of the universe : ultimate queen '' comes to the city as part of a uk tour .
the collection of more than 60 images were taken by the long-term queen photographer denis o'regan and more than half of the photographs have never been published before .
some bands provide more than music , they document a period of time for an entire generation , and queen were such a band .
although i 've worked with denis for a number of years now , i 'm still in awe of his talent , and this carefully selected body of work illustrates that talent in an amazing way . ''

documents.title: councillors ' fury over farm sell-off secrecy
text: accusations of distorting democracy by hiding a report which advised them not to sell off all of the county 's tenant farms have been made against the conservative ruling party on herefordshire council .
in december 2015 , the council voted to sell off all the smallholdings - ignoring the advice of consultants fisher german , who recommended the authority to keep some .

that advice was n't shared with groups who were asked to investigate the controversial decision , and it 's our county , the main opposition group , say it will continue to challenge the decision by `` all possible means '' .
steve clayton and joyce pritchard from rowlestone ( are due to be evicted from their farm in september .
this is a distortion of the democratic decision-making process and a perversion of the public record .
what 's the point of spending public money to receive expert advice , only to move mountains then to bury it when it 's not what you want to hear ?
it appalls me that the process of scrutiny has been so cynically and deliberately hampered and disrespected . ''
early this month the council issued a statement saying the initial draft of the fisher german report was incomplete and never finalised .
the report was therefore not relied upon by the council in any decision taking .
the council is promising a response to the claims made by it 's our county .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: travel : worcester link road to close overnight
text: the southern link road is currently being turned into a dual-carriageway .
overnight closure of # worcester southern link road tonight 9pm - 6am tomorrow .
closure mon-fri details :
