documents.title: la la land fiasco : council jumps on oscars ' bandwagon
text: worcestershire county council is using the embarrassment over la la land being wrongly awarded the best film oscar to highlight its own black pear tree competition .
here 's another award # lalaland ca n't win !
the # blackpeartree rewards our county 's best .
share your story at # oscars
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'family man ' jailed for sexually abusing a child
text: a 'family man ' from bromsgrove has been jailed for grooming and sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl with learning difficulties , after she sent him a friend request on facebook .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: billy ocean to play at worcester
text: the first act named as part of worcestershire county cricket club 's second year of the `` concert of legends '' is superstar billy ocean .
the r & b singer-songwriter is one of the biggest recording stars britain has ever produced , having sold more than 30m records .
the series of concerts returns this year on saturday 9th september .

documents.title: eastham bridge : 'light at the end of the tunnel '
text: a farmer living in the worcestershire village of eastham , which has been cut in half for 10 months after the bridge collapsed , has described the positioning of beams across the river teme as `` light at the end of the tunnel '' .
celia adams , who farms next to the the bridge , says they 're delighted they can now see the new crossing taking shape .
at the weekend , the beams to carry the deck of the new bridge were lowered into place .
the bridge is expected to open in the next couple of months .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : valkyrie is vegas bound
text: worcester valkyies ' player kelly smith is off to play in a sevens tournament in the usa .
well done to @ twitterid kelly smith who 's been named in england women sevens squad for their tournament in las vegas this weekend !
@ twitterid

documents.title: your photos : up-close to a pheasant in worcestershire
text: weather watcher .
j at severn ridge spotted a pheasant while out with his camera this morning in severn stoke .
terry gorsley captured a full rainbow at ross-on-wye , despite the grey skies .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: three cars involved in rush hour crash in kidderminster
text: three cars were involved in a crash on a busy road in kidderminster during rush hour this morning .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: ice warning bringing 'difficult driving conditions '
text: difficult driving conditions are being forecast by the met office for most of the west midlands due to ice .
they 've issued a yellow weather warning , running from 18:00 this evening until 10:00 tomorrow .
the met office says temperatures will fall below zero tonight on the back of showers today and into the night .
yellow warning of ice for west midlands
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'hatgate ' : bar co-owner defends dress code
text: the co-owner of a malvern bar embroiled in a row with the former eastenders star shane richie , dubbed `` hatgate '' , has defended the bar 's weekend dress code which bans hats .
mr richie , best known for playing alfie moon , the landlord of the queen vic , tweeted his frustration at being asked to remove his hat on entering the malvern lounge cocktail bar at the weekend .
co-owner , matt fletcher , tweeted back asking the actor to remove the tweet , but later apologised , - he said the bar has the rule so people 's faces can be seen on cctv .
we are a small cocktail bar so it does get a little bit crowded - touch wood , we 've never had a problem .
but if there was to be a problem , it 'd be nice to be able to say we know who that is or that 's the image of the person that 's caused this issue and pass it on to the police .
but you know , caps , they do hide faces '' .
the bbc has contacted shane ritchie 's management for a comment , but has n't had his side of the story yet .

documents.title: bird flu does n't care about borders
text: bird flu does n't care about borders
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: scheme aims to help reduce feelings of confusion and anxiety in those living with dementia
text: worcestershire is leading the country by trialling a ground-breaking scheme to help people living with dementia to stay safe and be independent for as long as possible .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: man injured after suspected 'glassing ' in bewdley pub
text: a man has been injured after a suspected `` glassing '' attack in a pub in bewdley , police say .
a 20-year-old man suffered a cut to his head and nose and bruising to his face after a glass was allegedly thrown at him in arches bar in severn side south shortly before midnight on friday .
west mercia police say they believe the assault happened after an altercation between two men and they 're appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: gps need more training to spot eating disorders
text: a worcestershire mother is calling for better training for gps after her eating disorder went undiagnosed for several decades .
nikki petrie , from redditch , developed anorexia at the age of eight , but as she had celiac disease , doctors only diagnosed she had an eating disorder as well six years ago .
more than 1.6 million people across the uk have an eating disorder and it 's estimated 10 % of all sufferers die as a result of their condition , according to the charity beat .
[ doctors ] just did n't listen to what i had to say at all - so it was just that i needed to put more weight on , i needed to eat more .
every time i went in , even if it was not related to food , the first thing they would say was 'you 're underweight ' .
it was almost like they stopped listening . ''

documents.title: more than one in five london midland trains 'late ' last week
text: almost a quarter of trains run by operator london midland were more than five minutes late last week .
the firm has .
tweeted its latest punctuality level figures , with only 76 % of its 6,490 trains arriving within five minutes of their scheduled times .
it 's the lowest percentage for any operator in february and is well below the 84 % average across the uk .
the operator say almost a quarter of the delays last week were `` london midland related '' , with 77 % due to `` other issues '' .
how our 6,485 trains performed last week : 91 % < 5m late ( uk average 90 % ) // cause of delays : 46 % lm-related , 54 % other issues # keepingtrack
but the consistency of them being called 'trains ' really bugs me ! ! ! ]
# pleasepassfeedback
okay benjamin .
i 'll get that passed on
thanks !
you have 6,485 trains ? !
gosh !
tyesely must have magically expanded overnight or something !
[ i know you mean train services
how our 6,490 trains performed last week : 76 % < 5m late ( uk average 84 % ) // cause of delays : 23 % lm-related , 77 % other issues # keepingtrack
does this include services which are cancelled as well as those which run late ?
this refers to late running services .
which makes the information technically accurate and compliant but is not the passengers ' experience .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more men reporting domestic abuse
text: a charity says the number of men reporting domestic abuse to west mercia police every year has gone up from 750 in 2012 to 2,000 in 2015 .
the man kind charity estimates only a third of incidents are reported .

lee , which is not his real name , from herefordshire , says when he reported being physically and verbally abused by his former partner , it was often he who had to leave the house - he was also the one arrested on several occasions .
people need to understand a woman can dish out domestic abuse as much as a man can - probably more in my opinion .
it 's the police - they either ca n't be bothered , or they just do n't understand the impact that it has on a male . ''
west mercia police says it is committed to tackling the crime and delivering a better response to victims , no matter what their gender .

documents.title: rugby : good news , bad news weekend for warriors
text: there was mixed news for worcester warriors yesterday - ben te'o was among the england try-scorers in the 36-15 win over italy at twickenham .
but , in the premiership , bristol beat bath 12-11 and so moved to within two points of warriors at the foot of the table .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: beams put in place on replacement bridge
text: the steel beams have been put in place on a replacement bridge across the river teme in worcestershire .
people have faced a 10-mile detour since eastham bridge , near tenbury wells , gave way in front of a school bus in may .
the two pairs of steel beams are 33m ( 108ft ) long and weigh 84 tonnes in total .
the bridge is expected to open to traffic in two months

documents.title: watch : weather for herefordshire and worcestershire
text: a blustery day ahead with some heavy showers .
and the possibility of hail .
there could also be a few brighter intervals with highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather
